text: {{Infobox writer | name = Barbara Ehrenreich | image = Barbara Ehrenreich 2 by David Shankbone.jpg | caption = Ehrenreich in 2006 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Barbara Alexander | birth_date = | birth_place = Butte, Montana, U.S. | death_date = | death_place=Alexandria, Virginia, U.S. | education = | occupation = | genre = Nonfiction, investigative journalism | movement = | notableworks= | influences = | influenced = | children = | spouse = | website = }} Barbara Ehrenreich (, ; ; August 26, 1941 - September 1, 2022) was an American writer and political activist. She was a well known person in the Democratic Socialists of America movement. Ehrenreich was best known for her 2001 book Nickel and Dimed: On (Not) Getting By in America. Ehrenreich died on September 1, 2022 under hospice care in Alexandria, Virginia from a stroke, six days after her 81st birthday. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American journalists Category:American political writers Category:American political activists Category:American socialists Category:Democratic socialists Category:People from Butte, Montana Category:Writers from Montana
